item.title: Need some help with item on item. Not a typical basic question
item.dc:creator: @Ii_1337_iI Ii 1337 iI
item.description:
@Ii_1337_iI wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:2, topic:145293”]Well, I can tell that you know what you’re talking about, so I’ll make it for you. Just a minute.[/quote]He He Thanks dude.[br][size=1]Posted on: September 21, 2007, 08:38:03 PM[/size][hr][quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:2, topic:145293”]Well, I can tell that you know what you’re talking about, so I’ll make it for you. Just a minute.

Ok, go to item.java or item2.java or whatever, and add this:

public static int whatever[] = {itemid,itemid,itemid,itemid,itemid};

then, you make an int under it to randomize the result.

public static int randomshit() { return whatever[(int)(Math.random()*whatever.length)]; }

Then, for the additem, just do this:

addItem(item.randomshit(), 1);

Try that and tell me if it works.[/quote]

Thanks alot, sorry for a non-instant reply my internet basicly took a shit on me.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some help with item on item. Not a typical basic question
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Well, I can tell that you know what you’re talking about, so I’ll make it for you. Just a minute.

Ok, go to item.java or item2.java or whatever, and add this:

public static int whatever[] = {itemid,itemid,itemid,itemid,itemid};

then, you make an int under it to randomize the result.

public static int randomshit() { return whatever[(int)(Math.random()*whatever.length)]; }

Then, for the additem, just do this:

addItem(item.randomshit(), 1);

Try that and tell me if it works.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some help with item on item. Not a typical basic question
item.dc:creator: @Ii_1337_iI Ii 1337 iI
item.description:
@Ii_1337_iI wrote:

I’m trying to make a new type of rc’ing and i was wonder how i can turn the code below into a like an else statement or some kind of thing to give you a random item every time.

if(itemUsed == 946 && useWith == 1511 ) { deleteItem(1511, getItemSlot(237), 1); addItem(235, 1); addSkillXP(6000, 17); }
To give you a random item… It’s probly going to need a public static int in item2.java but im to retarded to figure this out on my own.
Greatly helping if you help me out

Read full topic
